Unfortunately I had a very negative experience with Dr. Frownfelter. I had a complex constellation of symptoms, but instead of trying to talk it through with me she jumped to a common and insulting conclusion that it was "somatization disorder" (i.e., "all in my head"). She made the clinical visit worse when she passed on her written assessment to other doctors who then assumed the same and were equally dismissive. As a result, I had to go to a different clinic to get an unbiased viewpoint and receive the correct diagnosis of multiple sclerosis. So in a way, she was right- it was all in my head (Brain)- but psychologists don't help much with the physical symptoms of MS. Her suggestions were at best unhelpful; her manner condescending and cruel. If only she had taken the time to listen carefully or shown some empathy, I would have received treatment sooner, and saved money and time (and psychological distress). I do not recommend this doctor.

If I could give Dr. Frownfelter 10 stars for knowledge and helpfulness, I would. She is, by far, the best physician I've had. She has a very busy practice, but takes the time needed to listen, ask thoughtful questions and explore treatment options as appropriate. She has never hesitated, though, to act swiftly and decisively to pursue more aggressive treatments and/ or tests for health conditions when required. The only rating that's less than stellar applies to staff, who are difficult to reach at times. Her primary assistant is not nearly as conscientious as she is, which is surprising.
Dr. Milah F, is a good doctor. I have grouphealth insurance now but, for the short time i did have her she was very easy to talk to and very knowledgable. Niko

She is one of the best doctors I have had in my lifetime. I have been a patient for three years and have zero complaints. The staff is friendly and my wait time has always been minimal. Dr. Frownfelter is very thorough and takes the time to listen while keeping the appointment within a reasonable time. Excellent doctor.

You have Dr. Frownfelter listed as "M" and this doctor is "F", female. She is the best doctor in all categories. Her caring and concerned nature make her easy to communicate with. I have multiple ailments and she is very knowledgable in each of them. Her office location has changed and its more difficult for me to get there, however, I'd go to the moon to see her!
I though she was excellent. She was luid and I did not feel rushed. The receptionist in the office has these disgustingly long nails with landscapes painted on them...not good for a dr. office.

During the 3 office visits I've had with her, Dr. Frownfelter seemed to be very concerned about me and my health. That's not always the case with the medical system as is exists today, at least in a large city like Seattle. Usually you're herded in and out as quickly so the doctor can see as many patients as possible. Dr. Frownfelter spent more time with me in my first session with her (almost an hour and a half) then all the previous doctors I've seen in the past 10 years combined. She even followed up with 2 phone calls to check in on me after my office visit. Her nurse picked up my phone call immediately when I had a question and called me back within 10 minutes with an answer. Unfortunately Dr. Frownfelter doesn't accept children as patients, otherwise I'd switch my son's health care over to her without hesitation. I would highly recommend her without any reservations.

Dr. Rossi and his entire staff, (with a special nod to Debra) are the best people you could hope to have on your team if you are sick. Dr. Rossi literally saved my life and his team treated me like family all through my recovery. Dr. Rossi is extremely knowledgeable and is not one to rush you through an appointment. He and his staff are the best that you could hope for.
Very personable and responsive with follow up. Appears a bit glib and quick to form opinion on diagnosis without referring to other specialties.

I've been a patient of Dr Rossi for 12 years. His kindness, caring and compassion are matched only by the attentiveness of his staff. He keeps his appointments, he follows up and he is truly a kind and caring human being.

Very conversational and good at explaining what's going on. However, he tends to push pills and tests and seems to cast a wary eye to natural medicine, change in diet, chiropractic care and physical therapy.

I have been a patient of Dr. Johns for at least 30yrs. He is the epitome of being a fine, caring, considerate Doctor. Always listens and gives right on advice. He has been my families primary care physician forever. Thank You Dr. Gregory John for all the years, good and bad.

I go to him for general care or when I don't know the problem. If I think a condition is related to the heart, then I'll just skip the middle man and make an appointment directly with a cardiologist. I'm fortunate that my insurance allows me to do that.

Dr. John was my doctor for more than 15 years. He takes the time to listen - and is never dismissive, has a wonderful manner, and always helpful. His nurse Gloria is also great. I was treated in his office and also during several hospitalizations. He was there every morning and evening making sure I was getting the care he prescribed. He works well with other specialists both inside and outside the Polyclinic to coordinate care. He is responsive to phone calls and times when you cannot make it in to the office but need some help or a prescription. Anyone would be lucky to have him as their primary care physician. I am only sorry I moved out of state and can not longer see him. I can only hope that I can find a physician as great as Dr. John in my new state, but I am not holding my breath because they are few and far between. Do not hesitate to choose Dr. John and allow time to develop the doctor patient relationship. Takes some time but well worth the investment. Best wishes.
I have seen him for about 25 years. He has always resolved my health concerns. I would highly recommend him. He fights for your health. Very sensitive and caring and knowledgeable.

Dr Seth Franklin has been my Doctor for over 10 years. He is fantastic. I retired and moved 200 miles east of the Seattle and Dr Franklin is still my Doctor. Dr Franklin is so candid and effective that despite moving 3 hours from Seattle, he is still my Doctor!

Seth has been my doctor for 15 years, and I think so highly of him that I moved with him when he want to the concierge model. I'd put Seth in the top 5% of family practitioners. He listens well, explains options and treatment, makes sure he understands your whole health situation (physical, mental) and provides well thought-out options. I only see Seth about once or twice a year (annual physical and occasional stuff), but it's like visiting an old friend...that "old country doctor" in the heart of the city. My highest recommendation. Not sure if he's taking on new patients.

I was fortunate to have gotten a referral from my primary care physician to get diagnosis and treatment from Dr Jessica Brzana.
I had been bed ridden for 2 months starting with a case of the flu, but it became apparent that something else much more serious was causing me ongoing body aches and fatigue rendering me unable to function or get out of bed for more than 15 or 20 minutes at a time.
Immediately with my first consult Dr Brzana was able to determine the source of my problem, which was a hyperactive parathyroid that had become an adenoma producing too much hormone that controlled the amount of calcium in my body. She wasted no time in verifying her diagnosis with a battery of scans, ultra sounds, and blood tests.
Upon first meeting her I was struck with her compassion and bedside manner. It was obvious Dr Brzana sincerely cares about her patients and their families. I knew that I was in competent, capable hands with a good outcome. Every step of the way Dr Brzana would call me with follow ups on results from blood tests, from the various ultrasounds and scans.
I can't thank her enough for helping me get back on my feet.

I've dealt with so many doctors that have determined my health was perfect without really checking anything. And then later find out something was wrong! Its a refreshing change to have such a good doctor. She is also very likeable, very sharp, even for a doctor, and confidence inspiring. Exceptional doctor:-)
